author: torben
title: CrypTrolls: A DAO Gaming Experience
description: With centrally organized gaming companies, the users(gamers) lack governance possibilities within their own games. It's time to change this!

f6_assessments.q0: The team is proposing a game  that will be supported by a DAO once fully developed. This not only will bring players into Cardano, but will provide a use case for DAO applied to gaming. The gamers will then be involved in the process of gaming creation/evolution.
f6_assessments.q1:
Although the number of Twitter follower is extremely low, the project has just launched so it cannot be considered as the unique metric. 
The team has already developed a website where users can already purchase their NFT by spending ADA, and this is aligned with the roadmap included in the brief. The game will require a custom environment including virtual land and this will take time. By looking at The Sandbox as comparative example, this might take more than a year.
f6_assessments.q2: The fund request is high because of the riskiness of the project and the extensive development work needed. The roadmap is very clear, as well as the intention of using a centralized management for the first stages, with progressive introduction of the DAO in the further stages.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal show detail about the story of their game world and basic activities that I believe they will have a strong affect to the development of Cardano communities, indeed, it's within the challenge. 
In addition, the detail about the DAO in their game and especially player with no budget can join the game, with my experience that will attract a lot of players at early game. 
But they should give us some numbers or key metrics for this idea, it will help to clarify how strongly the idea impact and aligh with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
As the one that has less development experience, I recommend this proposal should provide some detailed explaination about how people in their team will develop it. 
And It's better if they have a more detailed timeline because it's too simple, but it's enough for realizing their important milestones. 
One last thing that can help their proposal assess better is their team info and duties that they will do in this project.
f6_assessments.q2: Again, lacking key metrics in this proposal make it hard for to everyone on auditing the project. In addition, the proposal should also provide a better timeline or roadmap, it will help the community well understand your works, when & where they can assess your results as you commit to the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This CrypTrolls: A DAO Gaming Experience proposal would help in more adoption of Cardano as the gamers have more saying in game development.
f6_assessments.q1: The breakdown budget in term of number of persons to handle the tasks are not clear ie. 1-5 positions. The total budget in implementing this proposal is quite big compared to other gaming proposals. The proposal should split funding into phases. Once the community is satisfied with the reached milestone, more funding could be released.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal should include the KPIs that allow the community to see some tractions and progress. The roadmap has not mentioned how to create a DAO or it is automatically created. It is an ambitious project (the scope of which are DAO & Gaming) and hence, it needs more info to see through the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal to build a DAO based metaverse game is well positioned in the gaming challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer includes a overview of the solution, a budget and a roadmap. No KPIs shared or documentation explaining how the game is being developed using Cardano NFT's and Plutus smart contracts (or centralized logic).
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided describes the game at a high level but very little of the proposal is used to describe the team's experience, list metrics or relevant KPI's or their development approach (outside of their roadmap included). This information is required to sufficiently audit progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal that clearly gives an opportunity for new gamers to adopt the Cardano ecosystem. It also tackles the key metrics of this challenge by adding NFT(s) into the gaming system.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap is very clear and it is well stated about the team members and their roles in this project. They have also set an achievable goal with the allocation of the fund.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer team has outlined, how they want to approach this big project. The budget allocation for the production of the project has been stated. It would be great to have an in-depth tokenomics of the liquidity program and treasury of the DAO.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal winthin the challenge, because with that concept and in-game activities or side activities will make effective impact to end user community. 
But, proposal should show some key success metrics, it will help everyone assess better how it is impact or alight with the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1:
- Proposal has explainations about the game story and how to play the game on basic. 
- They also detail about DAO and how they will use it in their system to support the game.

But

f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal lack of detail timeline and KPI for acquiring, and have too simple roadmap. 
They has website but just with general info, it hard to assess. 
For increasing autiability of the project they should provide some report channel about their working procecss if they can't make a detail timeline. And setting some inspired KPI for it can trust people.

f6_assessments.q0:
The detail content of the proposal show clearly how they solve the problem and that make a strong impact to the challenge. In addition, some point of the game that can help Cadano community expand faster and easier like free entry, multiworld in game... 
But this proposal should provide some metrics for showing how their proposal fit with the challenge more, for ex: how many user they will have on launching month, how many people they will get on marketing activities before launch, or numbers of event, interaction from social media channels... 
So, I will vote this proposal 4 on 5
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has a very simple roadmap that I believe that it not enough to assess the feasibility of $90k budget. For more trust and get a better assessment from everyone the proposal should detail the roadmap more, for ex: pre-sales their NFT, minting NFT, in-game protocol publishing, when marketplace can be published... 
Moreover, a detailed explaination about technology, or at least activities that will cost the budget should be included - at least on general will help it more trust about the feasibility of the project
f6_assessments.q2: The team has experienced expert people in the required fields for the project, so I think they should break down more the task into the timeline they will work on, and show some important key metrics. This will help to convince everyone to trust and audit this project better. It's good when they already have a project and Twitter account but should provide more place for showing their working results instead of just basic information. So, I vote for 2.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe it properly addresses the challenge. It is explained that in-game it will be possible to create, trade and even hire for work. That would motivate people to be more involved in the game and thus make more transactions.
f6_assessments.q1: I do believe there is a chance for this proposal to succeed. I agree that lean start-up approach in the beginning is a way to go. Too many people/opinions could slow down the project. Additionally I fully support the idea of free NFT for beginner players.
f6_assessments.q2: I have no experience in game development. That being said 3 months seems short period to have first concept of the game. Some with more experience could judge better. A bit more explanation on how the budget will be spent over time and what are some milestones would be also helpful.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal gives a backstory to the gaming experience but is vague on what the game actually is and why players would want to play it.  There is mention of a metaverse and several worlds to travel to, but it is unclear what are the objectives and different activities that a player can engage in.  The attached photos did not help.
One recommendation would be to add further detail on some of the games and their genre (There is mention of violent and non-violent games, but what are they?).  Are there strategy elements, PVP, resource building, crafting?  More details would help understand how this would entice gamers to the Cardano system instead of playing the existing games outside of Cardano.
A DAO implementation for user feedback would make this game more unique, but needs further examples.  Another recommendation would be to give examples of what kind of feedback or changes users could make to the game world.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal outlines a team of diverse background.  However, there are no references, experience or additional skills listed for the team members and their qualifications.
The budget is asking for a sizable chunk of the campaign (over 35%) so a more detailed budget would be expected.  The one provided appears to be only for developers and some marketing.
A recommendation would be to split this proposal amongst several catalyst fund cycles.  As the project shows more development, then request additional funding.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap that plans out major milestones of the project.
There are no KPI's or other measures of success.
A suggestion is to add KPI's that measure the growth and acceptance of users into the gaming experience.  Also, goals around the DAO usage and changes made by users would also help understand the success of the concept.

f6_assessments.q0: It is essential for us to have games in the environment that challenge the conventional game structure as play to earn and other incentive driven games become popular across chains. This proposal effectively addresses this challenge by proposing a game structure that matches the market direction.
f6_assessments.q1: The team seems to be well built and capable of implementing the proposal put forth for this challenge. It is my hope that as they explore the development of the game that they are honest with regards to the delivery time frame. I'm familiar with similar games on other chains that are seemingly well on the way with regards to their development but that development is taking more than 3-6 months.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient for an initial audit within a few months of dispersal with regards to cost of development. The concern I have is how much the team could accomplish with regards to development without running into cost of completion concerns. I trust that they have done the due diligence research with regards to the complete development and even if the delivery time line might be off. They are still able to deliver within the proposed monetary metric.

solution: DAO's make it possible to step away from centralized organizations. With this project, we will achieve this: gamers in control!
